results.title: Copper from Peko
results.creator_credit: Australian Instructional Films, Jean Halliday and Lex Halliday
results.brief_description: A survey of the copper mine at Peko, seven miles east of Tennant Creek in the Northern Terriitory. The mine is the fourth largest in the Commonwealth and produces ore containing 8.1/4% copper. The mine, still in various stages of development, is shown, and the various processes in preparing the ore for shipment to Port Kembla, via Alice Springs, are illustrated. With potential resources of lead and zinc, the Peko mine is further evidence of the mineral wealth of Australia’s Northern Territory.

results.title: Copper flashings and weatherings
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Plumbing”.
Making a copper slate, laying out the job on a drawing board, cutting out, flanging and welding the two parts, annealing. Soakers, chimney apron, step flashings, gutter. Protection of corners, internal and external.

results.title: Copper and bronze welding
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Plumbing”.
Autogenous welding, copper to copper, on heavy and light gauge tubes. Bronze welding: cup joint made with bronze filler strip first slowly and then at normal speed. Reducing joint: bronze welding copper tube to copper sheet. Alternative method: use of silver solder.

results.title: Coppelia
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), Autralian Ballet Foundation and Virginia Lumsden
results.brief_description: This ballet, directed by George Ogilvie, tells the story of Dr. Coppelius, a toymaker and magician, who attempts to bring to life his beautiful doll, Coppelia. He is fooled by the mischievous Swanhilda who masquerades as Coppelia and saves her lover Franz, from the Doctors’ magic. Features Colin Peasley, Lisa Pavane, Greg Horsman and the Australian Opera and Ballet Orchestra conducted by Noel Smith. Music by Leo Delibes. Choreography by Arthur Saint-Leon. Revised by Marius Petipa and Enrico Cecchetti. Reproduced with additional choreography by Peggy van Praagh.

results.title: Copland portrait
results.creator_credit: United States Information Agency, Freida Mock and Terry Sanders
results.brief_description: Aaron Copland in his 75th year talks about his life and music while shown working at the piano, leading choruses and conducting orchestras. Excerpts from his music include “Appalachian Spring”, “Fanfare for the Common Man” and “Rodeo”.

results.title: Coping: isolation and transience in a new Australian mining town
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Malcolm Otton and Phillip Robertson
results.brief_description: A study of four women’s lives in the remote mining community of Leinster, Western Australia. They are all members of the Country Women’s Association, a club which provides them with companionship in a strange environment. Details the daily life and social activities of the women and their families who live closely together in this remote town. Narrated by Philip Robertson.

results.title: Coping with stress
results.brief_description: Outlines the factors that cause body stress; how the body reacts to stress; the kinds of problems that are stress-related; and ways of coping with stress such as exercise, relaxation, meditation and biofeedback. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Coping with parents
results.brief_description: Three typical conflicts between teenagers and parents are dramatised: a girl’s mother nags her; a boy’s father regularly seems to criticise and argue with him; another boy says his mother “has no time for me”. The narrator then shows them how to change the situations by changing their response and by understanding people’s basic needs. Each dramatised situation is replayed, using the narrator’s suggestions and shows a positive solution to the problem.

results.title: Coping with life...on the run
results.brief_description: Dr George Sheehan, cardiologist and marathoner, and other runners from many walks of life, attest that fitness leads to an improved self-image and a more productive performance in daily jobs and professions. A motivational film stating that a good level of physical fitness is essential to being able to cope with everyday challenges. Produced in co-operation with the President’s Council on Physical Fitness and Sports.
